{"content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [ { "sha": "ca76098e98793f979d3ed999f1ffbcea7491c00d", "filename": "docs/fundamentals/copilot-entra-agents.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 20, "deletions": 32, "changes": 52, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fcopilot-entra-agents.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fcopilot-entra-agents.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fcopilot-entra-agents.md?ref=ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a", "patch": "@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ keywords:\n author: shlipsey3\n ms.author: sarahlipsey\n manager: pmwongera\n-ms.date: 08/22/2025\n+ms.date: 09/22/2025\n ms.update-cycle: 180-days\n ms.topic: overview\n ms.service: entra\n@@ -40,56 +40,44 @@ The following agents are currently available for Microsoft Entra. Due to the fas\n \n ### Access Review Agent\n \n-Empower your reviewers to make fast, accurate access decisions. The [Access Review Agent](../id-governance/access-review-agent.md) delivers insights and recommendations so reviewers can complete their work through a simple conversation, right inside Microsoft Teams.\n-\n-|Attribute |Description |\n-|---------|---------|\n-|Trigger | Runs every 24 hours or manually to gather insights and save recommendations. |\n-|Permissions | The agent reviews users currently in the scope of your access reviews, and makes suggestions on whether access should be approved or declined. The agent acts based on your selections. |\n-|Identity | The agent will run with identity of the administrator who configured the agent to gather insights and save recommendations. Final decisions as part of the Microsoft Teams conversation will be written with the reviewer’s identity. |\n-|Products | [Access Reviews](../id-governance/access-reviews-overview.md), [Security Copilot](/copilot/security/microsoft-security-copilot) |\n-|Plugins | [Microsoft Entra](/entra/fundamentals/copilot-security-entra) |\n-|Role-based access | Requires both the [Identity Governance Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#security-administrator) and [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#security-administrator) roles or the [Global Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#global-administrator) role. |\n-\n-Get started with the [Access Review Agent](../id-governance/access-review-agent.md)\n+Empower your reviewers to make fast and accurate access decisions. The [Access Review Agent](../id-governance/access-review-agent.md) with [Microsoft Entra ID Governance](../id-governance/identity-governance-overview.md) delivers insights and recommendations so reviewers can complete their work through a simple conversation, right inside Microsoft Teams.\n \n+| Attribute | Description |\n+|---------------------|------------ |\n+| Identity | Runs with identity of the administrator who configured the agent. Final decisions as part of the Microsoft Teams conversation use the reviewer's identity. |\n+| Licenses | [Microsoft Entra ID Governance or Microsoft Entra Suite](../id-governance/licensing-fundamentals.md) |\n+| Permissions | Get details for access reviews
Read details and lifecycle workflow history for users, groups, apps, and access packages
Save access review suggestions and justifications |\n+| Plugins | [Microsoft Entra](/entra/fundamentals/copilot-security-entra) |\n+| Products | [Security Copilot](/copilot/security/microsoft-security-copilot)
[Access Reviews](../id-governance/access-reviews-overview.md) |\n+| Role-based access | Both [Identity Governance Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#security-administrator) and [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#security-administrator) are required to configure and use the agent |\n+| Trigger | Runs every 24 hours or triggered manually |\n \n ### Conditional Access optimization agent\n \n The [Conditional Access optimization agent](../identity/conditional-access/agent-optimization.md) ensures comprehensive user protection by analyzing your Conditional Access policies and recommending improvements. The agent evaluates your current policy configuration against Microsoft best practices and Zero Trust principles.\n \n-**Key capabilities:**\n-- Identifies users and applications not covered by Conditional Access policies\n-- Recommends policies for multifactor authentication enforcement or device-based controls (compliance, app protection, domain-joined devices)\n-- Detects and helps block legacy authentication and device code flows\n-- Creates new policies in report-only mode for safe testing\n-- Builds a phased rollout plan for policy implementation\n-\n | Attribute | Description |\n |---------------------|------------ |\n-| Trigger | Runs every 24 hours or can be triggered manually |\n-| Permissions | Reviews policy configuration, creates new policies in report-only mode, suggests policy changes requiring approval |\n-| Identity | Runs with the permissions of the administrator who configured the agent |\n-| Products | [Microsoft Entra Conditional Access](/entra/identity/conditional-access/), [Security Copilot](/copilot/security/microsoft-security-copilot) |\n-| Plugins | [Microsoft Entra](/entra/fundamentals/copilot-security-entra) |\n-| Role requirements | [Security Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#security-administrator) or [Global Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#global-administrator) to configure the agent |\n+| Identity | Runs with the identity of the administrator who configured the agent |\n+| Licenses | [Microsoft Entra ID P1](licensing.md) |\n+| Permissions | Review policy configuration
Create new policies in report-only mode
Suggest policy changes requiring approval |\n+| Plugins | [Microsoft Entra](/entra/fundamentals/copilot-security-entra) |\n+| Products | [Security Copilot](/copilot/security/microsoft-security-copilot)
[Microsoft Entra Conditional Access](/entra/identity/conditional-access/) |\n+| Role requirements | [Security Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#security-administrator) to configure the agent
[Conditional Access Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#conditional-access-administrator) to use the agent |\n+| Trigger | Runs every 24 hours or triggered manually |\n \n ## Getting started with Microsoft Entra agents\n \n ### Prerequisites\n \n-- You must have at least the [Microsoft Entra ID P1](licensing.md) license for the Conditional Access optimization agent.\n-- You must have at least the [Microsoft Entra ID Governance or Microsoft Entra Suite licenses](../id-governance/licensing-fundamentals.md) for the Access Review Agent.\n - You must have available [security compute units (SCU)](/copilot/security/manage-usage).\n - In order to purchase security compute units, you need to have an Azure subscription. [Create your free Azure account](https://azure.microsoft.com/free).\n-- [Security Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#security-administrator) or [Global Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#global-administrator) automatically have the required permissions to configure the Conditional Access optimization agent.\n-- Both [Identity Governance Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#identity-governance-administrator) and [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator), or [Global Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#global-administrator) have the required permissions to configure and run the Access Review Agent\n - Review [Privacy and data security in Microsoft Security Copilot](/copilot/security/privacy-data-security)\n \n ### Setup process\n \n 1. Enable Security Copilot using the [Security Copilot setup guide](/copilot/security/get-started-security-copilot).\n-1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as a [Security Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#security-administrator) or with both the roles of [Identity Governance Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#identity-governance-administrator) and [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator).\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) using the least privileged role required for the agent you want to configure.\n 1. Browse to **Agents** and select **View details** for the agent you want to configure.\n \n ## Agents in the Microsoft ecosystem\n@@ -100,4 +88,4 @@ While this article focuses on Microsoft Entra agents, similar agents are availab\n \n - [Microsoft Security Copilot in Microsoft Entra](copilot-security-entra.md)\n - [Security Copilot scenarios in Microsoft Entra](copilot-entra-security-scenarios.md)\n-- [Microsoft Security Copilot agents overview](/copilot/security/agents-overview)\n\\ No newline at end of file\n+- [Microsoft Security Copilot agents hhttps://graph.microsoft.com/beta/networkaccess/connectivity/microsoft.graph.networkaccess.getWebCategoryByUrl(url='@url')?@url=msn.com/en-us/sports\n+GET https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/networkaccess/connectivity/microsoft.graph.networkaccess.getWebCategoryByUrl(url='@url')?@url=msn.com/en-us/sports\n ```\n \n > [!NOTE]" }, { "sha": "8fb5b4667605dc6546ec7b220bb43d6e5d0c2862", "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/how-to-customize-block-page.md", "status": "added", "additions": 60, "deletions": 0, "changes": 60, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-customize-block-page.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-customize-block-page.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-customize-block-page.md?ref=ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,60 @@\n+---\n+title: How to Customize Global Secure Access Block Page\n+description: Use custom block pages to display organization-specific messaging internet access policies block users from accessing websites.\n+author: fgomulka\n+ms.author: frankgomulka\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.service: global-secure-access\n+ms.date: 09/24/2025\n+ms.reviewer: kenwith\n+ai-usage: ai-assisted\n+---\n+\n+# How to customize Global Secure Access block page (preview)\n+\n+Use custom block pages to display organization-specific messaging internet access policies block users from accessing websites.\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+- Configure [Transport Layer Security (TLS) inspection](./how-to-transport-layer-security.md).\n+- Configure [web content filtering](./how-to-configure-web-content-filtering.md) and/or [threat intelligence filtering](./how-to-configure-threat-intelligence.md).\n+- Ensure you have the [Global Secure Access Administrator role](/azure/active-directory/roles/permissions-reference) or equivalent role in Microsoft Entra ID assigned.\n+\n+## Overview\n+\n+The custom block page empowers you to customize the default body of the page from, \"It's been restricted by your organization.\" you configure and preview tailored messaging to coincide with your organization's style guide when internet access policies block a user's request to access an internet resource.\n+\n+## Configure a custom block page\n+\n+1. Navigate to **Global Secure Access** > **Settings** > **Session management** > **Custom Block Page**\n+2. Switch **Custom body message** to **On**.\n+3. Configure the Customized body message you would prefer. For example, `Your admin at Contoso has blocked your access.`\n+4. (Optional) Paste one or multiple clickable links via limited markdown language (for example, `[click here](https://bing.com)`).\n+5. Preview the customized message with the **Preview** button.\n+6. Select **Save** to save the custom block page.\n+\n+![Screenshot showing the preview experience in the admin portal](media/how-to-customize-block-page/custom-block-preview.png)\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> A known transient issue in public preview could result in the configuration failing. While the Microsoft team works on a fix, the current mitigation is to reconfigure the custom block page and try again.\n+\n+## Verify the block page\n+\n+1. From a device with the Global Secure Access client installed and the Internet Access traffic forwarding profile enabled, attempt to navigate to a site that your policy blocks.\n+2. Observe the block experience and confirm the custom messaging displays.\n+\n+![Screenshot showing end user experience of the custom block page](media/how-to-customize-block-page/custom-block.png)\n+\n+## Notes and limitations\n+\n+- The Custom body message is limited to 1024 Unicode (utf-8) characters.\n+- Changes to a custom block page might take a few minutes to propagate to active sessions.\n+- Custom block pages appear for TLS inspected traffic only.\n+- A known transient issue in public preview could result in the configuration failing. While Microsoft team works on a fix, the current mitigation is to reconfigure the custom block page and try again.\n+- Ensure any contact information you publish complies with your organization's privacy policies.\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- If you need features beyond the preview's capabilities (richer templates, localization, or analytics), collect feedback and request expanded preview access from the product team.\n+- For guidance on configuring web content filtering, see [Configure web content filtering](./how-to-configure-web-content-filtering.md).\n+- For guidance on configuring threat intelligence, see [Configure threat intelligence](./how-to-configure-threat-intelligence.md).\n\\ No newline at end of file" }, { "sha": "46396e4f3441cd124ca8d57b0dd9ae6634d05205", "filename": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a/docs%2Fid-governance%2Faccess-review-agent.md", "contents_url": time-consuming research and the uncertainty of rushed decisions.\n - Admins must have at least **all** the following roles to set up and manage the agent in the Microsoft Entra admin center:\n - [Identity Governance Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#identity-governance-administrator)\n - [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator)\n- - [Security Copilot Contributor](/copilot/security/authentication#assign-security-copilot-access)\n+ - [Security Copilot Contributor](/copilot/security/authentication#assign-security-copilot-access) in Security Copilot\n - For reviewers to use the Access Review Agent, they must have access to Microsoft Teams and must have an active access review assigned to them. They must also have at least the [Security Copilot Contributor](/copilot/security/authentication#assign-security-copilot-access) role assigned to them.\n - Review [Privacy and data security in Microsoft Security Copilot](/copilot/security/privacy-data-security)\n " }, { "sha": "340bb925d1fcec3e373068cb87199dd3ac86cae5", "filename": "docs/identity/devices/concept-tokens-microsoft-entra-id.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 1, "changes": 2, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fconcept-tokens-microsoft-entra-id.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fconcept-tokens-microsoft-entra-id.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fconcept-tokens-microsoft-entra-id.md?ref=ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a", "patch": "@@ -51,7 +51,7 @@ Another difference between the two token families: Sign-in session tokens are re\n \n | Token Type | Issued by | Purpose | Scoped to Resource | Lifetime | Revocable | Renewable |\n |------|------|------|------|------|------|------|\n-| Primary Refresh Token (PRT)| Entra ID | Request Access Tokens | No – Can request an access token for any resource | 14 days\\*| Yes | Yes|\n+| Primary Refresh Token (PRT)| Entra ID | Request Access Tokens | No – Can request an access token for any resource | 90 days\\*| Yes | Yes|\n | Refresh Token| Entra ID| Request Access Tokens | Yes | 90 days\\* | Yes | Yes |\n | Access Token | Entra ID | Access the resource | Yes | Variable 60-90 minutes| Yes, if CAE capable | No |\n | App auth cookie| Web app | Access the resource | Yes | Determined by application| Depends on application | No |" }, { "sha": "b93143818971827f3761db5c7b05807c36a2c161", "filename": "docs/identity/role-based-access-control/protected-actions-add.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 1, "changes": 2, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a/docs%2Fidentity%2Frole-based-access-control%2Fprotected-actions-add.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/ac852d306b3588293657a86f7756463428c1341a/docs%2Fidentity%2Frole-based-access-control%2Fprotected-actions-add.md", "contents_url": +29,7 @@ To add or remove protected actions, you must have:\n \n Protected actions use a Conditional Access authentication context, so you must configure an authentication context and add it to a Conditional Access policy. If you already have a policy with an authentication context, you can skip to the next section.\n \n-1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com).\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Conditional Access Administrator](../role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#conditional-access-administrator).\n \n 1. Select **Entra ID** > **Conditional Access** > **Authentication context** > **Authentication context**.\n " } ]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: This commit introduces a new article on customising the block page for Microsoft Global Secure Access, along with its associated images and an update to the `toc.yml` to include it. It also refines the documentation for the Access Review Agent, clarifying role requirements and adding a note about its integration with Security Copilot. Further updates include a minor correction to an API URL in the Global Secure Access documentation, adjustments to the token lifetime description for Primary Refresh Tokens, and a precision update to the required role for adding protected actions in Microsoft Entra ID. Finally, the date has been updated for the Copilot and Entra Agents overview document.

author: Taojunshen
message:
Merge pull request #9825 from MicrosoftDocs/repo_sync_working_branch

Confirm merge from repo_sync_working_branch to main to sync with https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs (branch main)

  "patch": "@@ -51,7 +51,7 @@ Another difference between the two token families: Sign-in session tokens are re\n \n | Token Type | Issued by | Purpose  | Scoped to Resource | Lifetime | Revocable | Renewable |\n |------|------|------|------|------|------|------|\n-| Primary Refresh Token (PRT)| Entra ID | Request Access Tokens | No – Can request an access token for any resource | 14 days\\*| Yes | Yes|\n+| Primary Refresh Token (PRT)| Entra ID | Request Access Tokens | No – Can request an access token for any resource | 90 days\\*| Yes | Yes|\n | Refresh Token| Entra ID| Request Access Tokens | Yes | 90 days\\* | Yes | Yes |\n | Access Token | Entra ID | Access the resource | Yes | Variable 60-90 minutes| Yes, if CAE capable | No |\n | App auth cookie| Web app | Access the resource | Yes  | Determined by application| Depends on application | No |"
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: This commit updates a table in the Microsoft Entra ID documentation regarding token types. The primary change modifies the 'Lifetime' of a Primary Refresh Token (PRT) from '14 days\*' to '90 days\*'. This adjustment likely reflects a change in the default or maximum duration for which PRTs are valid when requesting access tokens.
